cosmology.name: The Great Wheel
cosmology.description: The default D&D cosmology includes more than two dozen planes. The most common understanding visualizes them as a group of concentric wheels, with the material realms at the center. The Inner Planes form a wheel around the Material Plane, enveloped in the Ethereal Plane. Then the Outer Planes form another wheel around that one, arranged according to alignment, with the Outlands linking them all. The Positive and Negative Planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing the raw forces of life and death that underlie all existence in the multiverse.

alternateConfigurations.name: World Tree
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes situated among the roots and branches of a great cosmic tree (literally or figuratively)

alternateConfigurations.name: Vertical Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Material realms suspended between two other realities: the astral realms (the Astral Plane and the Outer Planes) above and the elemental realms (the Inner Planes) below

alternateConfigurations.name: Simplified Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: A cosmology with fewer planes: a Material Plane; the Transitive Planes; a single undifferentiated Elemental Plane; an Overheaven where good deities and Celestials dwell; and an Underworld where evil deities and Fiends reside

alternateConfigurations.name: Orbital Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes arranged in a complex system of orbits, with planes exerting greater influence on the Material Plane the closer they draw to it

planeCategories.name: Material Realms
planeCategories.description: Most D&D worlds are located on the Material Plane, which has two planar echoes: the Feywild and the Shadowfell.

planeCategories.name: Transitive Planes
planeCategories.description: The Ethereal Plane and the Astral Plane are boundless realms that provide passage between other planes of existence.

planeCategories.name: Inner Planes
planeCategories.description: The four Elemental Planes (Air, Earth, Fire, and Water), plus the Para-elemental Planes between them, are the Inner Planes.

planeCategories.name: Outer Planes
planeCategories.description: Seventeen Outer Planes correspond to the nine alignments and shades of philosophical difference between them.

planeCategories.name: Positive and Negative Planes
planeCategories.description: These two planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing the raw forces of life and death that underlie all existence in the multiverse.

planes.name: Positive Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: The source of radiant energy and the raw life force that suffuses all living beings. Like the heart of a star, it is a continual furnace of creation, a domain of brilliance beyond the ability of mortal eyes to comprehend. It is a vibrant plane, so alive that travelers are empowered by visiting it.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Characters who survive an excursion into the Positive Plane often find that it leaves them with a lasting charge, making it hard to calm down, to stem the flow of ideas, and even to sleep. On the other hand, they also find themselves with a persistent resistance to disease and despair.

physicalProperties.shape: Like a dome above the other planes, no surface, akin to the Elemental Plane of Air with its wide-open nature
physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: The plane has no surface and is akin to the Elemental Plane of Air with its wide-open nature. However, every bit of this plane glows brightly with innate power.
physicalProperties.dominantElement: Radiant energy and raw life force

timeFlow.description: No specific time flow alteration described for the Positive Plane.

hazards.name: Pervasive Radiant Energy
hazards.description: The Positive Plane has no surface and is akin to the Elemental Plane of Air with its wide-open nature. However, every bit of this plane glows brightly with innate power. This power is dangerous to mortal forms, which can't handle it for long. Only creatures that have Immunity to Radiant damage can survive there for long.

environmentalEffects.name: Blinding Brilliance
environmentalEffects.description: Like a dome above the other planes, the Positive Plane is the source of radiant energy and the raw life force that suffuses all living beings. Like the heart of a star, it is a continual furnace of creation, a domain of brilliance beyond the ability of mortal eyes to comprehend.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: Every bit of this plane glows brightly with innate power. This power is dangerous to mortal forms, which can't handle it for long. Only creatures that have Immunity to Radiant damage can survive there for long.

lightModification.naturalLightSource: The plane itself glows brightly with innate power, like the heart of a star — a continual furnace of creation.

dayNightCycle.description: No day/night cycle. The entire plane is a continual furnace of brilliant radiant energy.

lightModification.colorDescription: Brilliant radiant glow beyond the ability of mortal eyes to comprehend

environmentalEffects.emotionalEffect: Travelers are empowered by visiting it. Survivors find a lasting charge making it hard to calm down, stem the flow of ideas, and even to sleep, but also gain persistent resistance to disease and despair.

environmentalEffects.name: Lasting Charge
environmentalEffects.description: Characters who survive an excursion into the Positive Plane often find that it leaves them with a lasting charge, making it hard to calm down, to stem the flow of ideas, and even to sleep. On the other hand, they also find themselves with a persistent resistance to disease and despair.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: After surviving a visit, characters experience difficulty calming down, stemming the flow of ideas, and sleeping, but gain persistent resistance to disease and despair.
environmentalEffects.emotionalEffect: Lasting charge of creative energy; hard to calm down or sleep; persistent resistance to disease and despair.

specialRules.name: Radiant Immunity Survival Requirement
specialRules.description: Only creatures that have Immunity to Radiant damage can survive on the Positive Plane for long. The innate radiant power that suffuses every bit of the plane is dangerous to mortal forms.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Only creatures that have Immunity to Radiant damage can survive there for long. All other creatures are endangered by the plane's pervasive radiant energy.

adventureThemes: Confrontation with overwhelming positive energy nearly as dangerous as the Negative Plane's annihilation
Lasting empowerment and lasting side effects from exposure
Seeking rare planar essences or artifacts of creation

planarTravelMethods.name: Planar Portals
planarTravelMethods.description: A portal is a stationary, interplanar connection that links a specific location on one plane of existence to a specific location on another. Portals can function like doorways, locations, or vortices.
requirements: Meeting the portal's requirements (command, key item, random, situation, or time)

planarTravelMethods.name: Planar Travel Spells
planarTravelMethods.description: A number of spells allow direct or indirect access to different planes of existence.
requirements: Ability to cast the relevant spell
risks: Varying degrees of precision in destination

globalPlanarDissonance.description: Celestials who visit the Lower Planes and Fiends who visit the Upper Planes experience significant discomfort if their visits last more than a few hours. After finishing a Long Rest on a plane that is alien to its nature, a Celestial or Fiend makes a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, whenever the creature makes a D20 Test, the creature must subtract 1d4 from the roll. The effect is cumulative with each failed save and ends when the creature finishes a Long Rest on a plane that isn't opposed to its nature.

savingThrow.triggerDescription: After finishing a Long Rest on a plane that is alien to the creature's nature

onFailure.description: Whenever the creature makes a D20 Test, the creature must subtract 1d4 from the roll. The effect is cumulative with each failed save.
onFailure.cumulativeDescription: Each failed save adds another 1d4 subtracted from D20 Tests

savingThrow.repeatSaveTiming: After each Long Rest on a plane alien to the creature's nature
recoveryMethods: Finishing a Long Rest on a plane that isn't opposed to the creature's nature

savingThrowProbabilities.formula: P(fail | modifier m) = max(0.05, min(0.95, (DC - 1 - m) / 20))
